intro: Phaseolus linearis f. subrhombeus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed runner bean, is a variant of the common runner bean characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is native to the Americas. The plant is an annual climbing legume that produces edible, bean-like pods. Its botanical features include trifoliate leaves, small white or pale pink flowers, and a fibrous root system. It is often cultivated for its edible seeds and ornamental value in gardens.
